title: Inconvenient Truths Shatter Kerry’s Net-Zero Dreams
sub_head: When can we have an honest discussion of a plan to reduce carbon emissions?
body:
John Kerry and the Democrats call for net-zero emissions but seem not to realize their policies prevent an economically viable transition (“John Kerry Responds on Natural Gas’s Future,” Letters, April 26).
Mr. Kerry states that natural gas is a central component in cutting greenhouse-gas emissions, which makes one wonder why his colleagues are fighting off natural-gas pipelines. Similarly, he writes of stopping flaring without mentioning that it is occurring in the U.S. because the efforts of environmentalists and politicians have led to a lack of new pipelines.
